title: How to Make Banana Jam or Jelly

steps.title: Look at the ingredients list to find what you need.
steps.content: Look at the ingredients list to find what you need. Put all those things out in front of you.

steps.title: Take the bananas.
steps.content: Take the bananas. Slice the banana into very thin pieces. This is a must if you want the Jam to turn out right. Put them aside in a bowl for later.

steps.title: Fill the pot with 1 cup of sugar.
steps.content: Fill the pot with 1 cup of sugar. Stir continuously. Cook until brown. Medium heat. You can't step away for more than 10 seconds.This will burn if not watched carefully.

steps.title: Add 1/3 a cup of water and the banana slices you put aside once brown.
steps.content: Add 1/3 a cup of water and the banana slices you put aside once brown. Add the water then the bananas.

steps.title: Keep stirring on low heat.
steps.content: Keep stirring on low heat. When soft and no banana pieces are noticeable, turn off heat.

steps.title: Put in a container or covered bowl and put in the fridge until chilled.
steps.content: Put in a container or covered bowl and put in the fridge until chilled.

steps.title: Pour water into the saucepan.
steps.content: Pour water into the saucepan. Add the sugar until it is above the water level.

steps.title: Heat the mixture.
steps.content: Heat the mixture. Stir it until it thickens.

steps.title: Add the sliced bananas to the thickened sugar solution.
steps.content: Add the sliced bananas to the thickened sugar solution. Stir and cook until thoroughly softened.

steps.title: Remove from the heat.
steps.content: Remove from the heat. Allow to cool.
